translated: Elder’s Birth Stories
The Chapter with Nāgasamāla
The Elder Sūcidāyaka’s Birth Story

analyzed: tisa kappa sahassamhi  sambuddhaḥ loka nāyakaḥ
translated: “For thirty-thousand eons,🔽the Awakened One, the Leader of the World,

analyzed: sumedhaḥ nāma nāmena  bāttisa vara lakkhaṇo  tassa kañcana vaṇṇassa
translated: named Sumedha,
with thirty-two excellent marks,
I gave five needles🔽to make a robe for that one of golden complexion,
that Leader of the Two-footed, that One of Strength.
Because of that gift of needles,

analyzed: nipuṇa attha vipassaka  tikkham lahuñca phāsuñca
translated: I became skilled in penetrating the meaning,
and my knowledge became sharp, quick, and easy.
My defilements were burned up,
and all my existences were destroyed.
I bear this last body
in the Dispensation of the Perfectly Awakened One.
I was four kings named Dvipadādhipati,
endowed with the seven treasures,
universal monarchs of great power.
I attained the four analytical knowledges …
I have done the Teacher’s bidding.”

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā sūcidāyako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā sūcidāyakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: Thus the elder Sūcidāyaka recited these verses.
The seventh chapter.
